oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 1912 baseball team
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 1912 baseball team with the letter M on their jerseys. Correspondence from Hoge Swafford to Mr. and Mrs. Thos. Farmer on reverse. Samuel Preston Hoge Swafford Sr. was born in Litton, Bledsoe County, Tennessee, on November 15, 1889. He was the son of; Thomas and Mary Hoge Sawfford. His half-sister, Hester, was married to Thomas Farmer. Swafford's WWI draft registration card lists him as a "deaf-mute" and the 1900 census lists him as living at the Tennessee Deaf and Dumb School in Knoxville, Tennessee.
